Collaborates with internal Business and IT Analysts to understand detailed revenue recognition requirements and system interfaces. Translate requirements into technical design solutions for the ETL layer into the new application.

This position serves as the portfolio subject matter expert (SME) for cloud enabling applications. Applications will be a mix of legacy migration and new development. Position will be a member of a global team responsible for recommending cloud enablement strategies, as part of the portfolio's DevOps initiative. The resultant cloud enabled applications will be deployed in Verizon Data Services private cloud, as well as AWS (Amazon) public cloud.
The portfolio currently has ~60 applications that are either in the process of refactoring or under consideration for migration into the Amazon public cloud. Refactoring, in conjunction with the new features, has created an opportunity for PaaS implementations, that will automatically provide the highly desired ability to scale & descale the compute resources.
Position will be required to work autonomously in driving cloud-enablement within the portfolio. Position is responsible for keeping the DevOps director informed on related implementation issues, to be accompanied with remediation recommendations whenever technically feasible. Position will regularly meet with portfolio development directors/associate director/managers and/or individual contributors to assist cloud enablement for their respective applications. He seeks upper management assistance when needed and has excellent judgment on when to escalate issues in his own management chain.
Develop/Provide best development & implementation practices for cloud enabling legacy applications. Practices to include:
Guidelines for selecting the appropriate cloud technology, including both Verizon Data Services private cloud offerings and AWS public cloud offerings (within contract agreements).
Guidelines for PaaS-oriented development & implementations (e.g. Cloud Foundry/Kubernetes).
Guidelines for development & implementation of other container technology (e.g. Docker).
Guidelines for development & implementation into cloud compute VMs (e.g. OpenStack).
For legacy application, practices to also include code refactoring guidelines towards development of microservices.
Consult/Assist application development teams towards cloud-enabling applications for the selection and development for the target environment, per above best practices.
Candidate will also collaborate with his direct leadership team for communications with IT leadership regarding forecast direction and changes.
Qualifications
Required:
BS / CS or equivalent and possess 5+ yearsâ€™ experience in Subject Matter Expertise in the developing cloud enabled applications including, but not limited to:
Cloud Foundry
Docker,
OperStack VMs,
Kubernetes,
AWS (EC2, EC2 Container Service, S3, Elastic File System, Elastic Beanstalk, Lambda, RDS)
Note: The predominate development language for above is JAVA.
Must be able to function with limited direction and guidance and be able to diagnose a wide variety of problems.
Must possess excellent communication skills.
Must be able to work in a team environment, demonstrate leadership skills and be able to mentor junior engineers both technically and follow established business practices and guidelines.
Preferred:
10+ yearsâ€™ experience in above

This Data scientist is responsible for discovering patterns in massive amounts of network data (Utilization, Probes, Topology, etc.). In this roll, the individual will include implementing descriptive, predictive and prescriptive capabilities to improve the network and therefor improve the customer experience. The individual will create data models that 1) Catch issues in the network that are affecting the customer experience. 2) Predict issues in the network that will affect customer experience and 3) enable the network operations centers to repair the network before there is degradation.
This position is for a capability in Verizon called Network Performance Intelligence (NPI). This is a groundbreaking approach to mining billions of network events and performance metrics a day to generate actionable alarms, which would have resulted in a customer impacting event. This approach leverages the massive streaming data crunching and storage capability of Hadoop infrastructure combined with power of in stream rules engine and various forecasting techniques. There are four modules, which works together â€“ 1) Hadoop infrastructure for streaming, rules engine and storage, 2) Dynamic Thresholding Engine, which uses forecasting technique to reduce false positives, 3) Scoring and Rating engine to prioritize and finally 4) case management engine to manage the root cause and resolution.

Responsibilities
The primary role of the Contact Center Solutions Associate Director is to deliver system experiences for internal customers, contact center representatives and technicians, that are simple, leverage big data and insights and are interconnected.
The Contact Center Solutions Associate Director will report to a director or vice president and will be responsible for evaluating key strategic initiatives and projects that span the entire organization. The candidate will be required to frame and answer complex organizational, operational and strategic questions from a direct supervisor, key stakeholders and executive leadership. The ideal candidate will need to be able to work collaboratively across Verizon and with Customer Engagement Execution leads and possess advanced analytical abilities, initiative and independent thinking.
The Associate Director will be leading a team with responsibility for collaborating with internal and external resources to design, communicate and support large-scale successful system deployments. These efforts will be primarily focused on the following:
Research industry trends and critique, analyze and improve ongoing areas of contact center operational deficiencies using latest trends

Ability to clearly convey ideas, concepts and status to all levels of management and associates

DevOps Engineer Job Description
Responsibilities:
Define DevOps strategy in coordination with internal and external customers/partners. Research, define, document, promote, and lead the implementation of bleeding edge DevOps models, methods, tools, and technologies in support of DevOps transformation strategy and CI/CD pipeline for multi-data center/multi-cloud auto-scaling, microservice-based application deployments
Exploration and constant learning of latest DevOps and cloud based technologies, trends, and best practices. Identify, evaluate, propose, and implement enhancements to DevOps strategy and existing processes
Evaluation of existing production applications and recommend enhancements with a focus on improved security, scalability, performance, and availability
Design, deploy, and maintain standards, best practices, and processes for production support, incident response and root cause analysis, capacity and performance management, health and security monitoring, disaster recovery, application building, packaging, configuration management, QA, and deployment.
Internal and External Community Engagement:
Work with engineers and product management teams across multiple organizations to advise and influence architecture and technical strategies.
Develop, and promote the development of, architectural/technical documentation, whitepapers, presentations, and proposals
Lead by example and mentor teams through regular guidance, coaching, internal workshops, and cross training.
Qualifications
Requirements:
Core Competencies
Broad technical background in server, storage, network, cloud, and DevOps areas. Highly energetic focus on constant learning
Ability to multitask while keeping a strong attention to detail, while maintaining focus on overall objectives and prioritizing efforts accordingly
Sharp analytical, problem solving, and creative thinking skills. Expert troubleshooting, debugging, and solution design and implementation skills
Excellent presentation, demonstration, active listening, and interpersonal communication skills. Must be tactful and persuasive, with the ability to clearly and concisely articulate technical details to all levels of technical and non-technical individuals.
Excellent relationship and partnership building skills with customers, vendors, peers, and upper management, within and across organization boundaries
Technical Competencies
Extensive experience designing large scale distributed systems with deep understanding of design impacts on performance, reliability, operations, and security.
Extensive experience troubleshooting, debugging, and performance tuning at all levels (OS, network, application, database, and network) within large scale distributed systems
Deep understanding of the TCP/IP, and low level packet/frame architecture, as well as a thorough understanding of the usual network stack technologies and protocols such as Bonding/Trunking, SSL/TLS, SNAT/DNAT/PNAT/Bridging, BGP, OSPF, VRRP, VLAN/VXLAN, IGMP/PIM, MPLS
Extensive experience in shell scripting/programming skills, systems provisioning, automation, and configuration management tools
Solid understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle phases, including system analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging and documentation
Solid understanding of self-healing/immutable microservice based architectures, cloud platforms, networking technologies, multi-tenant application/database/storage technologies
Aptitude for learning technical concepts, skills, and systems quickly
Comfortable exploring the unknown
Familiarity with DevOps ecosystem, expertise within many areas:
System Provisioning/Automation/Configuration
FAI, Kickstart, Cobbler, ipmi, redfish, iLO/DRAC, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Packer, Terraform, Vagrant, Docker, Jails, chroot, iptables/UFW/netfilter
Operating Systems
CentOS, Ubuntu/Debian, Alpine Linux, CoreOS, RancherOS, Project Atomic, Other *Nix and *BSD operating systems
Web/Load Balancer/Proxy
Apache HTTPD, Apache Tomcat, HA Proxy, NGINX, Fiddler, Paros Proxy, WebScarab, Varnish, Vulcand, fabio
Cluster/Container/Cloud Orchestration
Docker Swarm, Fleet, Kubernetes, Mesos, Marathon
Service Registration/Discovery
Consul, Registrator, confd, etcd, Zookeeper
Distributed Block/FileSystem/Object Storage and Database Systems
ceph, GlusterFS, CouchDB, Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis, memcached, MySQL, MariaDB
PLM/Documentation/Collaboration
Atlassian stack (JIRA/Confluence/Bamboo/Stash/HipChat/etc), GitHub/GitLab Issues/Pages, Kanboard, Redmine, Markdown/Jekyll, Mattermost/Rocket.chat
Source Code Management
git, Stash, GitHub, GitLab
Build/Integration
Bamboo, ant, maven, continuum, archiva, jenkins, travis, GitLab-CI, Artifactory, SonaType Nexus
QA/Code Quality
SonarQube, JUnit, JProfiler, Selenium
Performance/Load/Stress Testing
JMeter, ab, httperf, gatling
Monitoring/Log Management
Sensu, Nagios, Zabbix, Zenoss, Splunk, Graphite, InfluxDB, Prometheus, elastic search/logstash/Kibana (ELK), fluentd, rsyslog, syslog-ng, greylog
Application Performance Management
Stagemonitor, Scouter, Pinpoint, Bucky, AppDynamics, DynaTrace, NewRelic APM
